page.title: 20TRANSPORT CANALS.
page.content: Roughly through the middle of the block runs the Trent and Mersey Canal. It was designed by James Brindley,who lived in North Staffordshire,and was originally opened in 1777.It was also called the Grand Trunk Canal,because it linked the waterways of the country at the time. It was a very busy canal in its hayday,but now it is only used for recreation mainly.People use the canal for boating holidays,fishing or just walking or running along the towpath.In Longport by the canal there are two public houses,their names are The Packhorse and The Duke of Bridgewater they are both named after things connected with the canal.Packhorses were used to carry goods from the canal to the factories,and the Duke of Bridgewater provided the money for the first canal.
